info.author: João Ferreira
info.description:
**pyrrhic**

is an interface for dealing with the output of external programs.

It defines a base class to be inherited from, implementing the desired behaviour. By itself it does nothing.

It expects a class composed of static methods (only) to be decorated with one of four implemented behaviours.
Behaviours may be interlocked, given four default behavioural structures, four classes may be derived for any number
of programs to be executed.

Such classes composed of static methods only are expected to be program-specific with each method returning a
string of arguments to the program.

See `how_to.py` for an explanation.

**frame_hack**

is a x-function means to get local-scope variable names as strings.
info.name: Pyrrhic
info.summary: Interface for dealing with the output of external programs
